intro: Senecio lanuginosus, commonly known as the wooly senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that give it a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens.
